alert.note: Alert for Coachella Valley; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 13 at 9:42PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...Significant flow expected in the Whitewater River and the Coachella Storm Water Channel by Wednesday afternoon... Rain is forecast to develop over the San Bernardino Mountains and northern portions of the Coachella Valley late Tuesday morning and become heavy Tuesday night through Wednesday morning. A high freezing level will allow most of the precipitation to fall as rain. In addition to rain, snowmelt will continue and run off into the Whitewater River wash. Rainfall of 2 to 5 inches likely on the mountain slopes by Thursday...with 1 to 2 inches possible in the lower elevations, including in the San Gorgonio Pass. As runoff accelerates off the San Bernardino Mountains...significant flows will develop in the Whitewater River. These flows are forecast to reach Palm Springs midday Wednesday...and flow southward through the Coachella Valley to Indio and beyond during the afternoon. The flow will impact low-water crossings and may create dangerous swiftwater areas through the valley. The rain will diminish Wednesday evening...but some flow will likely continue in the canal through Thursday. Residents should be prepared for road closures and listen for later advisories.

area.areaDesc: Coachella Valley; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning
